meanings.def: the direction that you look towards to see the sun go down; one of the four main points of the compass
examples: Which way is west?
Rain is spreading from the west.
to the west (of…) He lives to the west of (= further west than) the town.
The train line facilitates travel between east and west.

meanings.def: the western part of a country, region or city
examples: The west of the country is especially popular with tourists.
Around 2 000 teachers from around the West of England attended the conference.
in the west Elsewhere in the West, wet, unsettled weather will continue until the weekend.
House prices in the west have risen significantly over the last five years.
There's been a severe earthquake in the west of the country.

meanings.def: Europe, North America and Canada, contrasted with other parts of the world
examples: I was born in Japan, but I've lived in the West for some years now.

meanings.def: the western side of the US
examples: the history of the American West

meanings.def: Western Europe and North America, when contrasted with the Communist countries of Eastern Europe
examples: East–West relations
West Africa
the west coast of Scotland
on the west side of the building
Australia's west coast
the museum's west wing

meanings.def: a west wind blows from the west
examples: prevailing west winds
This room faces west.
The vehicle was last seen heading west on 39th Street.

meanings.def: nearer to the west than something
examples: They live five miles west of Dublin.
